comments.comment: Does the loss_and_gradient_se3.py example work for you with PyTorch backend? I get: RuntimeError: Trying to resize storage that is not resizable at /pytorch/aten/src/TH/generic/THStorage.c:183

Similar error here, in my case running this case: <denchmark-link:https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/kaushaltrivedi/bert-toxic-comments-multilabel/blob/master/toxic-bert-multilabel-classification.ipynb>https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/kaushaltrivedi/bert-toxic-comments-multilabel/blob/master/toxic-bert-multilabel-classification.ipynb</denchmark-link>
While fitting, a single epoch completes and quits with: RuntimeError: Trying to resize storage that is not resizable at /pytorch/aten/src/TH/THStorageFunctions.cpp Did you find any solution?
Thank you for your interest! We are still working on the pytorch backend and examples and will update the codebase when we get them running.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ningxia>@ningxia</denchmark-link> sorry for the delay in addressing this! These examples should now work with pytorch backend. Do not hesitate to be in touch again if you are encountering issues!
